description: From Old French vire, from virer (“to turn”). Compare veer, vireton.

verbs.description: vire (third-person singular simple present vires, present participle viring, simple past and past participle vired)

entries.meaning: to transfer a surplus from one account to cover a deficit in another, to make a virement.
examples: For example, in 1993, only 8 per cent of the survey schools said that they were likely to vire funds if problems arose during the year.
